channel.title: Bad at Naming
channel.description: Recent content on Bad at Naming

item.title: Dimensional Range
item.description: This method generates every coordinate between c1=(x1, x2, ..., xn) and c2=(y1, y2, ..., yn) as long as len(c1) == len(c2). def any_range(c1, c2): assert len(c1) == len(c2) x, *c1 = c1 y, *c2 = c2 lower, upper = [(x, y), (y, x)][x > y] for n in range(lower, upper + 1): if not (c1 and c2): yield (n,) else: for down in any_range(c1, c2): yield (n, *down) from pprint import pprint In [9]: pprint(list(any_range((-2,4),(2,2)))) [(-2, 2), (-2, 3), (-2, 4), (-1, 2), (-1, 3), (-1, 4), (0, 2), (0, 3), (0, 4), (1, 2), (1, 3), (1, 4), (2, 2), (2, 3), (2, 4)]
